intro: Eupatorium fastigiatum, commonly known as white boneset, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems and clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its medicinal properties historically used by Native American tribes.
